pros:
Pay
Smart  people 
Great Tech 
Awesome Product

I  loved it till it was time to  move one
cons:
At the time I left,  people were pretty unhappy and it was a harsh enviroment. I felt  on edge and the  enviroment was poor. That seems to have improved post IPO but before it was very churn and burn.

The job become my life  and that was not  was I wanted anymore.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Portsmouth, NH
pros: The culture at HubSpot is second to none. You'll love your coworkers and enjoy all the different perks and activities that are included.
cons: It can be hard to move into a completely different department than the one you start in. We're still growing so there are some career paths that just haven't been established yet.

review_title: First time in my career that I look forward to coming to work
pros: Autonomy, velocity, meaningful work, culture, transparency, perks & benefits, work/life flexibility and modern facilities.
cons: Career paths are not clearly defined and compensation isn't competitive with peer organizations.

review_title: A great place to learn and grow as an engineer
pros:
Great co-op / intern program 
Small teams with complete ownership over your team's part of the product
Amazing co-workers to learn from and have as mentors 
Great culture of learning from mistakes 
Can work from home multiple times a week
cons: Work life balance can be a little rough at times depending on your role but being able to work from home and unlimited vacation definitely help.

review_title: HubSpot Support is the best place to start your career in Tech.
pros: I came into this job with a non-tech background. We went through a three-month onboarding program and I now feel like I got a mini degree in technical troubleshooting. My team is amazing, the advertized culture is real.
cons: Wish I could get paid more, but who doesn't wish that.

review_title: Dynamic and demanding meets failure friendly and flexible
pros: At a high growth place like HubSpot, it's easy to identify and create new opportunities for your own growth and development and there are always new challenges to solve. Resources are abundant, people are supportive and high achieving and you'll have all the autonomy in the world if you're producing.
cons: Priorities change constantly, the bar for performance sometimes feels unattainably high (which pushes employees but can be frustrating), management is stretched thin.

job_title: Inbound Marketing Consultant in Cambridge, MA
pros: Great culture, smart people here at HubSpot make it a fun place to work at.  Young culture means something always going on.
cons: The monthyl sales quota makes it stressful on sales reps which can transfer to stress on consultants, otherwise it is a great place to be.

review_title: Awesome Company Firing on All Cylinders
pros: When a company is executing so well, the work goes easy. People are hard working, but work without stress and the junk that goes along with that is a joy. It's so exciting to get to produce and delight customers.
cons: It can be hard to explain to your friends what you do. Everyone has heard of Google, but HubSpot isn't so well known.

review_title: Awesome People working to help People
job_title: Security and Risk in Cambridge, MA
pros: Fun team orientated environment - always put the customer first.  A company that truly cares about customers and culture.  Focused on work hard, play hard mentality.
cons: Management should increase the information flow to empower the employee's, they get it and  understand what needs to be done to reach our goals.

review_title: An impressive company with a strong future.
job_title: Business Development Representative in Cambridge, MA
pros: Intelligent employees, brand recognition helps in sales, fun environment and a great launching pad for a software career. Fun environment and definitely easier to appreciate for younger members of the work force.
cons: Don't quite drink their own cool-aid as much as they say regarding marketing and sales processes. Training has become a bit outdated for their product and market. Clearly I'm really picking to find cons.

review_title: If you want to be in tech sales, work here.
pros:
- Brian and Dharmesh are amazing leaders, with a great vision, open to feedback and transparent. 
- An amazing product, and great product fit for the market. The sky is the limit. 
- The culture is real, we walk the walk. 
-
cons: - Sales training/managementtraining can use improvement, but they have heard us loud and clear and are working on it.

pros:
* friendly team
* flexible career planning and progression
* most problems go away in a company that's growing 30% a year, so it's pretty sweet all around
* close relationship with other international offices
cons:
* there is no air conditioning in the office (though we will probably have moved by next summer)
* our developers are based in Dublin and Cambridge, so if you want to hang out with engineers the Berlin office is not ideally located

pros: Work anywhere. The people are amazing. The leadership is the best I have seen, with Brian Halligan leading the charge. He is an amazing leader and inspires his direct reports to be amazing alongside him. The dedication we show to clients for satisfaction is second to none and I am glad to be a part of it.
cons: I can't think of a single one.

pros: Newest technologies, great people, challenging, focused and rewarding environment.
cons: Pressure is high to GSD and those that don't will have to leave. Only the strongest will survive.

job_title: Channel Account Manager in Cambridge, MA
pros: HubSpot really is a great place to work.  The product, people, and culture are industry leading and, as long as you enjoy a fast-paced/challenging environment, you'll grow and learn a ton.
cons: Career/compensation progression is a little slow.  Great place to start your career but older reps might find themselves hitting a ceiling.

review_title: The best people I've worked with in my life.
pros:
* Amazing people that care and are a joy to work with.
* Fast growth creates great opportunities.
* Invests in culture and people better than any company I know.
cons: They will challenge you and push you. They're big believers in constant learning. They'll give you an uncomfortable level of autonomy -- which makes it an intense place.

job_title: Principal Account Executive in Boston, MA
pros: HubSpot is an amazing company. I would highly recommend a career in sales at HubSpot. If you are looking for your next role and want to be part of a high growth company selling multiple product lines I would recommend working here in an instant.
cons: I have nothing bad to say about HubSpot at all. Honestly.

job_title: Business Development Representative in Cambridge, MA
pros: All of HubSpot leaders give you the autonomy to work despite your position. This creates a very supportive culture and makes you feel safe to make mistakes and quickly learn on the job. The company also invests a ton in the culture, making sure everybody feels welcome and creating a sense of belonging regardless of your culture, race, gender, backgrounds, etc.
cons: There's not enough time during the day to attend all events and seminars!

review_title: Always Growing Better professionally and personally @ HubSpot
job_title: Audio Visual Engineer in Dublin, Dublin
pros:
Huge emphasis on career growth and personal growth.
Genuinely lovely people and incredible working environment.
Trust and scope to help improve and grow better.
cons: I can honestly say there is no cons I can think of. I love working here and would highly recommend to everyone!

pros: Great product, talented and kind people, the career progression system is fair and objective. It is an incredible opportunity to work for a company where people try their best constantly; being surrounded by people who are driven and want to be remarkable is priceless as you always feel motivated.
cons: Even though the training is great and well planned, it requires extra effort to get used to the amount of acronyms in the company

pros: I worked alongside some of the most intellectually curious and humble people in Boston, and I grew more professionally and personally at HubSpot at any other company.
cons: Sometimes it’s hard to take risks and try new things where the company is such a well oiled machine.

job_title: Inbound Marketing Specialist in Cambridge, MA
pros: Great product, great culture, great leadership, SMART/FUN people. I've worked at several other tech companies in the past and HubSpot completely blows them away
cons: Definitely a lot of work but worth it. Although there is "unlimited vacation" most people are not taking it and working 10+ hours a day.

pros:
-Leadership places a heavy emphasis on employee growth across all divisions, from tuition reimbursement to offering opportunities to take on challenges outside your core responsibilities. 
-Transparent culture from top to bottom.
-Management actually listens to employees, and makes quick changes to structure if/when needed.
-Flexible working hours.
-People here are incredibly smart and passionate, genuinely fun to work with.
cons: -HubSpot is a fast paced, results driven org that isn't made for everyone.

review_title: Not the time to be a hubspot employee
pros:
-Culture at hubspot is great
-compensation is competitive
cons:
-Lots of changes going on right now
-Lack of support from management  
-HubSpot prides itself on transparency - but you still feel like you don't know what is going on most of the time 
-I wouldn't recommend taking a sales role right now at Hubspot

job_title: Channel Account Manager in Dublin, Dublin
pros: Smart people who respect the value individuals bring to an overall team/corporate goal. Paid for performance. Excellent perks. Gym, health, education allowance. Breakfast & lunch provided. Free beer & wine & ping pong.
cons: Work hard play hard. Lot of decisions made in US head office. More localized decision making required. Increased promoting opportunities for individual contributors needed.

job_title: Customer Support Specialist in Portsmouth, NH
pros: Opportunities for growth early on in your career. Transparency across departments and ranks gives you an opportunity to network and learn from different departments.
cons: Average age is pretty young and lots of first time managers

review_title: Great place to grow your career
pros: Autonomy, Mentorship, Small Teams, Strong leadership, engineering focus, Growing quickly
cons: None for me.  Some might that teams have too much autonomy, that the pace is a bit quick, or that the team is a bit young (average age is 28), but I like it.  Also, a small percentage of people have been here for more than 5 years, though those people tend to have a lot of influence.

pros: I've worked here for almost three years and have never considered leaving. I am supported in my job, work with amazing people, and have had many opportunities to grow my career. Support for flexible work schedules and remote work is also great.
cons: Like most tech companies, the engineering team is very white and male. However there have been a lot of efforts to try to fix this in the past few years.

review_title: Potential, Potential and So much Potential
pros:
Great business model and a Great Product with lots of untapped potential and ambitious growth plans. 
Have made strong progress but still early enough in the journey that every individual can make a real impact
The culture code is real - everyone here personifies HEART in their own way
Big focus on Diversity and Inclusion
cons: Compared to every other place I have worked - there is really nothing to complain about here

pros: I've been at HubSpot for about three months, and I've never worked at another company with a smoother or more thoughtful onboarding process. HubSpot makes it clear from the beginning how much they care about you both as an individual and as a part of their team. Definitely a place that values both intelligence and kindness. I'm really looking forward to building a career here.
cons: At this point, nothing comes to mind.

pros:
My two years at HubSpot has been the most rewarding and challenging (in the best way) two years of any job I've held. 

HubSpot deeply care about our customers, our employees, and our product! 

- Autonomy 
- Balance 
- People
- Challenging
- Learning 
- Leadership
cons: As a HubSpot employee, you have to be willing to work hard. This fast paced environment isn't for everyone, but it's incredibly rewarding if you're an ambitious person.

review_title: Everything it's cracked up to be!
job_title: Content Marketing Manager in Seattle, WA
pros:
HubSpot presents itself as a fun-loving, highly empathetic, adaptable company and that is exactly what it is. Everyone in this company has more integrity than any other place I've worked.

• Room for growth
• Fast-paced environment
• Upper-level management is open to new ideas and experimentation
• Low-stress, highly productive environment
• Caring, honest,  intelligent co-workers
cons:
• Pay is less than average
• Diversity numbers are typical of a tech company (i.e. low)

review_title: What an amazing place to work
pros: Great team of smart people around you all fighting for the same mission. The product is ever changing and growing for the better. The culture is awesome and there is a great amount of flexibility - especially when you are doing well!
cons: It’s a tough role, but you are given the resources and tools needed to be successful.

review_title: I love working with smart, motivated people who are empowered to do what's right for the customer
pros:
* The people are intelligent and motivated
* The culture is very positive and thoughtfully curated
* The tech stack is a dream to work with and most stuff "just works"
* Management is aggressive but is pragmatic and focused on value
cons: With lots of small, autonomous, empowered teams it can take a lot of coordination to make cross-cutting initiatives happen.

pros: They will train you better than any other company I know
cons: A bit of a fraternity mentality-- but I think people intentionally work to overcome that. It's a weird dichotomy of being welcomed and feeling un-welcomed. It's probably just me, though. :-)

review_title: 18 months in, time to leave a review!
pros:
Transparency and the vision of senior management.  Great to work for a place where you can really believe in the direction senior management is taking.  

I highly recommend HubSpot to anyone looking for a new job regardless of the role.
cons: Sometimes can hire/promote young managers that don't have enough business experience.

job_title: People Operations Specialist in Cambridge, MA
pros:
Job Autonomy
Excellent Culture
Outstanding Co-Workers

I am always excited to come into work- I love the people I work with and feel like I am learning something new every single day.
cons: All-in-all not much to call out here. I think we need to train mid-level leadership better. But I know this is already on leaderships radar, so I am excited about the future!

pros:
Empathetic, inclusive leadership
Emphasis on getting things done (so highly engaged and active teams)
Overall supportive culture
Lots of autonomy
Support of remote work
cons: Some growing pains around balancing the scrappier model with the needs of a fastly growing and diversifying business (especially when it comes to planning). Just more corporate ops stuff as the company continues to grow and transition, especially globally and remotely.

review_title: As good as everyone says it is
pros: You are around smart, cool people all day long, with a company and product you can truly get behind.  Perks are great, 401k and Employee Stock Purchase Program are great too.
cons: Not a con for me, but no job at HubSpot is a 9-5.  No one stays in one role for years and "coasts". Every HubSpotter is expected to be constantly growing, improving, and learning.

review_title: Fast-pace environment where you can't stop learning
job_title: Associate Product Manager in Cambridge, MA
pros: HubSpot offers a phenomenal culture which inspires you to work hard, learn fast and help others. Not only is the company growing fast and attracting motivated and dedicated employees with a lot of talent, but it also fosters a culture of curiosity, continuous growth and experimentation.
cons: Folks who are looking for a slow, 9-5pm work won't fit in at HubSpot. This isn't really a con. :)

pros: The engineering department does everything they can to set you up for success. There are so many people that are willing to go the extra mile to help you grow and improve as an engineer.
cons: There are some people who say that the work life balance isn't the best. I definitely agree that some of the core teams work a lot, but I think that those teams are the minority .

pros: A culture built on learning and stretching your mind. I've been challenged to be very agile in my work and learning from outside sources and my peers to come to a good solution. "This is the way it's always been done" is not part of the conversation here. Which I love
cons: With things moving quickly, sometimes people are working on the same thing at the same time. Silod communication.

review_title: Sweet spot from a scale perspective, and amazing people
job_title: User Experience Researcher in Cambridge, MA
pros:
- Culture that encourages entrepreneurialism
- Maturity in state of organization that is exciting and helpful (all your efforts have the potential to scale, and you have a good amount of resources to do so)
- Great peers to work with
cons:
- Comes with any entrepreneurial environment, but at times can feel like there is not enough structure and focus
- Could improve diversity in leadership roles

pros: Company truly cares about you, the product is world class and they continue to hire intelligent, driven people.
cons: Like any company you have your growing pains and as we continue to scale there will be things that will take time to get right, nothing is perfect.  There's a lot of different things being thrown at you at once, if you can juggle all of these you'll succeed.

pros: I have worked in many companies prior to HubSpot, big corporate companies and also startups. HubSpot manages to add the fun startup vibe to a fast growing and stable business. I could not be happier with my colleagues, I have the freedom to work on projects and a lot of support from management.
cons: Challenges due to the fast growth - But we are managing it really well all together

pros: HubSpot's motto is Grow Better. This philosophy drives everything we do for our customers, but also everything they do for the teams and for each employee within the company. I have never before been in a place where I was so spoiled, but also so challenged to give the very best of myself. If you want to grow better, HubSpot is the place for you.
cons: No fully remote opportunities yet.

pros:
- Constantly Challenged
- I made a career shift internally during my team here and it was welcomed
- Fast paced, innovative environment
- Office Space is amazing
cons: - Constantly Changing Environment - not necessarily a con, but you have to be adaptable to thrive here.

job_title: Inbound Sales Coordinator in Dublin, Dublin
pros:
- Career development and opportunities to grow 
- Company culture | Completely transparent 
- PEOPLE | I never met so many remarkable personalities that are at the same time so down to earth
(also a huge thank you to our daily catering ladies)
- Onboarding in the US couldn't be a better start
cons: - Dog policy only on Fridays maybe? ;)

pros: I really recommend working for HubSpot, the executive team has a strong vision for the future and there's definitely many initiatives and programs to grow your career. I keep on being impressed with the freedom that each employee has and how information is communicated and shared freely within the company.
cons: The company is growing so fast that it is sometimes hard to keep up with with all the new-hires.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Dublin, Dublin
pros:
- Most everyone I've worked with in here has been a pleasure
- Development infrastructure and tooling is great
- Small teams and plenty of responsibility/opportunities to learn
cons:
- The lingo/vocabulary/abbreviations can be a bit of a pain to learn on top of soaking up everything else
- Hearing phrases like "our customers bleed orange" and the corny cheering at technical talks kills me inside

pros: Good work/life balance, real good perks (free food, beer, etc). Company is growing fast so you can have a big impact on the direction it is going. The company seems to be doing amazing, no end in sight.
cons: Because it is growing so fast there's not a lot of process in place or great communication among teams, but that's what comes with moving fast.

review_title: Gave me hope in the corporate world
pros:
Being my second job out of college, HubSpot completely changed my view on what a job is. This place makes me exited to go to work everyday. 

Great people, challenging job and amazing culture throughout the company.
cons: Few, but sometime going the extra mile is not recognized in specific positions.

job_title: Channel Account Manager in Dublin, Dublin
pros: Great product, smart people, high ambition to grow and develop as a company
cons:
Sometimes things go a bit to fast and things might not always be thought through all the way before making a change. On the other hand hubspot is quick to learn adapt. 

It's a high performance company with high expectations on their sales reps. But that's what we sign up for so not really a con...

review_title: Great for fresh grads, experienced professionals look elsewhere
pros:
Autonomy
Flexibility/ WFH
Office perks
Great product
Company invests heavily in onboarding
cons:
Lack of career growth opportunities
Young and inexperienced management
No diversity especially in the sales org
Not the place for strong female leaders to succeed
Your past experience and education is of no value once you join, expect to wipe your slate clean and start over
Perks and compensation is more suited for young professionals in their early 20s

review_title: Best place I have ever worked
job_title: Customer Success Manager in Cambridge, MA
pros:
The culture here is truly second to none
The product is above reproach 
Leadership is very transparent 
Never have to fight for commission getting paid
cons:
Growing really fast and focusing a lot on the global growth so things can be sloppy sometimes 
Career growth can be challenging, but just start a conversation

review_title: Great company to have an impact at and continue to learn
pros:
- Smart coworkers who are willing to help you.
- Interesting and relatable company mission and product impact.
- Growth opportunities at a global scale.
- Challenged professionally to do your best work.
cons: - Growing this quickly and at the size we are already at can be challenging.

review_title: You Don't Know How Good It Is Until You've Been Elsewhere
pros:
Strong leadership
Innovative
Not afraid to do the hard things in the spirit of doing right by customers
cons: Some mediocre middle management slip through the cracks, overall, not too much to be unhappy about.

review_title: Really nice company to work for and amazing colleagues to work with!
pros: I have joined the company recently and had an amazing onboarding. Everyone takes the time for you. You are trusted for who you are and for your skills. You can also evolve as there is a huge internal mobility. Plus the company offers many employee benefits.
cons: Be ready to work a lot and never be scared of trying/testing things.

review_title: Amazing Culture - Work life balance is unparalleled
pros: Leadership is very transparent. A lot of room for opportunities for professional and personal growth.  Challenging , exciting work and there is never a dull moment.
cons: To continue hiring more people of color. It is a topic that the organization as whole is working towards to. I would encourage you to keep that front and center as the company continues to grow.

review_title: Inexperienced management, 50/50 chance for good work/life balance
pros: Free snacks and friendly coworkers.
cons: Inexperienced managers who became managers by default when sales teams got too big, coupled with the lack of development of those managers led to terrible leadership experiences.  Worked 60+ hour weeks for months and got nothing but flak for it.

pros: Exciting energetic environment, good growth opportunities.  Strong company culture code - makes for good blend of people who want to "GSD" get stuff done and in turn get to enjoy numerous perks within the offices, as well as fun company wide and departmental outings.
cons: Lengthy hours at times - but overall worth it.

pros: supportive environment, positive culture, and an amazing sales trainer Lauren that will give you ALL the resources you need to succeed
cons: hours can be long at the beginning (but it's worth it in the end)

pros:
-A leadership and People Ops team who genuinely care for their employees and how to improve their experience
-Flexibility
-Community through employee resource groups
-Great benefits
-No shortage of challenging work
-Autonomy
cons: The pace at which things change can be a bit overwhelming if you're not used to it.

pros:
* Incredibly clever people that are open and approachable
* A culture that allows me to bring all of me into work and know people will accept me.
* Numerous opportunities to grow into new jobs
* Incredible emphasis on self-development, including money for your own tuition each year.
cons: * All teams are not necessarily treated equally, ie Sales & Product vs Services.

review_title: Truly the best place to work
job_title: Consultant, Technical Architect in Atlanta, GA
pros: Company culture, benefits, the people, flexibility, pay, exciting and fun work, diversity
cons: Honestly, haven't found any yet. Remote work is still somewhat new to HubSpot so there are times that being remote can be a bit challenging and feel a bit isolating, but they're working really hard on this and are doing a great job navigating the remote world.

review_title: Great place to spend some of your career
pros: Very smart people; laser focused; Very process oriented; Transparency like no other company! They know what they are doing in their business and eat their own dog food.
cons: Tough to not work endless hours (partially because it is an engaging place). Consider whether you can "double down" Mon-Fri to ensure your success here.

pros: People, culture, product, company, work life balance...everything is great! Never thought a company could be this satisfying. It's truly an honor to be working here. Plenty of activities going on constantly to help the culture.
cons: Really nothing significant. Very happy to be here. If you're not an A player you may get overwhelmed.

pros:
- Colleagues that care. 
- Commitment to diversity and inclusion (at a level I've never seen before, and I've been in tech for nearly a decade)
- Incredible transparency into the business
- Moving to be a product-driven organization which is amazing
- Perks :)
cons: - Change happens frequently and quickly, it's hard to stay on top of

pros: Best corporate culture and management in the software sales game (not to mention best in class product... easiest thing to sell). Fact! Dogs, too!
cons: None - absolutely none of you care about your job and understand this grass is VERY GREEN.

pros:
If you are looking for somewhere to grow and develop - not just in your career but also your personal life... then these guys have it down to a fine art.  
Summary:
-onboarding/training is 2nd to non
-surrounded by amazing people all day (who love what they do)
-full pantry, great offices, free lunch
cons: -The company is growing fast and has so many things happening it can be distracting

pros:
- Hubspot has a great culture and amazing benefits (unlimited PTO, stock options, tuition reimbursement, snacks, coffee  barista, dog-friendly) 
- Big emphasis on D&I which is great to see.
- Managers that are there to support you and who actually care about your personal growth.
cons: - HubSpot moves fast to expect changes almost daily. Sometimes this is good but it can be challenging at times.

job_title: Inbound Success Coach in Dublin, Dublin
pros:
- Genuine care for the employee well-being and personal development 
- Endless benefits (health insurance, free food and snacks on site, gym reimbursements, unlimited time off etc)
- Young, dynamic and SUPER international environment! 
-
cons: - Due it's contant growing nature, there are regular changes made in the product and organization, so you need to adaptable and flexible to changes

review_title: The engineering focused culture here is amazing. Great place to work if you want to learn from experienced engineers!
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Cambridge, MA
pros: Work life balance is great. Recently HubSpot has really opened up to allowing employees to work remotely full time as well which is a really nice option.
cons: Because engineering is so fast moving and there are a lot of teams it can sometimes be hard to work with other teams.

pros: Fast growing, always improving.  Individual autonomy and freedom to develop the best ideas.  Recognizes and values smart, GSD people.
cons: Growing and organizational pains, although that's an area of focus.  Diversity is pretty weak.

review_title: I'm glad I took the opportunity
job_title: Channel Account Manager in Dublin, Dublin
pros:
The Pay
The People - HubSpot tends to hire great staff
The Culture
One of the coolest offices I have ever worked in
cons:
Work/Life balance
Tends to promote managers based solely on sales performance as a rep

review_title: Great Place to Work if You're Proactive!
pros: Lovely people, terrific opportunities, transparency, and folks who actually care about all those buzzwords (think: work/life balance, unlimited vacation, diversity and inclusion).
cons: Certain times of the year can be overwhelmingly busy. It can be hard to get help/direction because there's a lot of self-starting/proactivity expected, and other teams might be too busy to help you if your project isn't in their "lane."

review_title: Clear career progression and utmost transparency
job_title: Principal Business Development Representative in Sydney
pros:
- HubSpot is one of the most transparent companies I have ever worked for and I've never seen that reflect in a negative light 
- Metrics for promotion and progression are performance-based to eliminate any kind of uncertainty 
- Everyone is friendly, welcoming and always willing to help a fellow HubSpotter!
cons: - none that I can really think of at this time!

job_title: Inbound Marketing Consultant in Cambridge, MA
pros: Loved it. Most of HubSpot is a really great experience where you will learn many new things. Try to keep up.
cons: Why does it care about 20 words here? The beer is less free than it used to be.

pros: The Renewal Management team is a great team to be on. We are a new team but growing very quickly. It is always exciting to be a part of something new. Obviously there are some growing pains but the process has been built out extremely well for us.
cons: None that I can see right now!

pros: I genuinely enjoy working with everyone on my team. I have autonomy in my work, schedule, and I feel fully supported by my manager. Lots of opportunity for career development.
cons: I wish there was more of a clear path to advancement for my current role. Sometimes the upper management says they will do things or make something more clear but then it doesn't happen.

pros:
- Open forum for resource-sharing, giving and receiving feedback
- Unlimited PTO 
- Fast-paced and GSD mentality
- The opportunity to create your own projects and run with them with very little red tape
- Opportunities for career growth and development
cons: - Compensation is very low for the industry standard

review_title: Honestly the best place to work, develop and grow!
job_title: Channel Account Manager in Dublin, Dublin
pros:

- Love the job, continuous professional and personal development
- Clear upward career path
- Best in class perks (unlimited holidays, great food, etc.)
cons: Has become slightly less personal due to growth of the business. Teams have become more separate over time as the amount of people has grown.

review_title: The best company I've ever worked for
pros:
- Genuinely humble, brilliant people
- Excellent training and resources
- People care about your success and growth
- Diversity initiatives are part of the DNA, not an after-thought
- People care about your personal and mental health too
- Great leaders
- Awesome customers
cons: Even if I really tried, I honestly can't think of a single thing to complain about.

job_title: Inbound Marketing Specialist | Account Executive in Sydney
pros: Great people, great view! Fantastic sales support and a really positive team feel. As a very sales focused office, the collaboration and team work I've been surrounded with has been fantastic.
cons: The office is a little small, should be growing and moving to a bigger space soon.

pros:
Perks (Kitchen is my fav)
Commute
Intensive Training
Everyone is super helpful and ready to get you going on whatever project your are taking
cons: Not a very diverse environment but I hear they are working on it. ( Make sure to try and retain qualified minority talent throughout all orgs not just sales)

pros: Between the free snacks/beer and the gym, I have everything I need at the office. Culture is catered to everyone and the company outlook is great.
